definition: confused/disorderly/incoherent
top (of the head)/apex/to fall forwards/inverted/to jolt
surname San
three/3
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
four/4

sentences.english: Jack began to buff and puff when asked awkward question.
sentences.chinese: 要是問到棘手的問題，傑克就開始顛三倒四地胡說。

sentences.english: The children gave a confused account of what had happened…
sentences.chinese: 孩子們把發生的事敘述得顛三倒四。

sentences.english: But Andrew continued to act strangely and had trouble finding the right words when speaking.
sentences.chinese: 但是安德魯每天仍然舉止怪異，講話的時候顛三倒四。

definition: to exaggerate
lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
to persist in one's views
overbearing/arrogant bully
words do not convey the meaning/poorly expressed/senseless/inarticulate
sequel/continuation of a book
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
equivocal/ambiguous
obscene language
sharp ears and keen eyes (idiom)/keen and alert/perceptive
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
synonym/close equivalent expression
to make a story or theory consistent/to give a plausible explanation/to plug the holes in one's story
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
